longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports issued to nationals of Sweden must be valid for
  the period of intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- For additional exemptions and requirements see passport
  exemptions mentioned for the USA. 

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for nationals
of Sweden traveling as a tourist, on business or in transit
(SEE NOTE 49199) (SEE NOTE 49201) (SEE NOTE 49202) (SEE NOTE
49203) (SEE NOTE 60199). 
    NOTE 49199: Passengers must obtain an ESTA authorization
   (via https://esta.cbp.dhs.gov/) prior to boarding. 
    NOTE 49201: Passport issued on or after October 26, 2006
   must be biometric (i.e. e-Passport, containing an
   integrated chip).
    NOTE 49202: Passport issued on or after October 26, 2005,
   but prior to October 26, 2006 must:
   - be machine-readable and contain a digital photo; or
   - be biometric (i.e. e-Passport, containing an integrated
   chip). 
    NOTE 49203: Passport issued prior to October 26, 2005 must
   be machine-readable.
    NOTE 60199: Passengers must hold a return/onward ticket.
Minors:
- Minors travelling accompanied by one parent or by a person
  other than parent/legal guardian . 
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Sweden will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination. (SEE NOTE 46947)
    NOTE 46947: Exempt are holders of a valid US visa
